definition: every beginning is difficult (idiom)/getting started is always the hardest part

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: My business is in the beginning phases, and everything is always hard in the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我的事業在剛剛起步當中，不說萬事開頭難嗎？

sentences.english: Beginning is difficult for everything, let us study hard , more practice , more better.
sentences.chinese: 萬事開頭難，讓我們如力學習，越實踐越好。

sentences.english: There's a first time for everything. You know what I mean?
sentences.chinese: 萬事開頭難。你明白我的意思吧？

sentences.english: “At first it was difficult, ” he confessed.
